H0.text: Birds are the broad animal group thought to have evolved from theropod dinosaurs around 150 million years ago.

H1.text: Insects are the broad animal group thought to have evolved from theropod dinosaurs around 150 million years ago.

H2.text: Mammals are the broad animal group thought to have evolved from theropod dinosaurs around 150 million years ago.

H3.text: Reptiles are the broad animal group thought to have evolved from theropod dinosaurs around 150 million years ago.

A4.text: Birds are a specialised subgroup of theropod dinosaurs and, more specifically, members of Maniraptora, a group of theropods which includes dromaeosaurids and oviraptorosaurs, among others.

A5.text: The oldest known paravian (and probably the earliest avialan) fossils come from the Tiaojishan Formation of China, which has been dated to the late Jurassic period (Oxfordian stage), about 160 million years ago.
